page.title: 09TRAFFIC IN EWOOD, BLACKBURN
page.content: On Tuesday 4th June 1985, we carried out a traffic survey for 20 minutes on Bolton Road, the A666 from Darwen to Blackburn. The total number of vehicles heading towards Blackburn was 206, and heading towards Darwen was 230. Of the total going towards Blackburn, there were 7 buses/coaches, 50 commercial vehicles, 145 cars and 4 cycles/motorcycles. Of the total heading towards Darwen, 5 were buses/coaches, 60 were commercial vehicles, 157 were cars and 8 were cycles/motorcycles. We thought that this was a large number of vehicles, especially when we considered that it was not a market day in either Blackburn or Darwen.
